opennlp.ccg.lexicon
Class EnglishExpander

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.lexicon.EnglishExpander

public class EnglishExpander
extends Object

EnglishExpander provides methods for expanding numbers, amounts, durations, dates and times as English words. The class com.sun.speech.freetts.en.us.NumberExpander served as a reference point in part, but the implementation has been rewritten from scratch, streamlined and extended.

Version:
$Revision: 1.7 $, $Date: 2005/10/20 17:30:30 $
Author:
Michael White

Constructor Detail

EnglishExpander

public EnglishExpander()
Method Detail

expandDate

public static void expandDate(Date date,
                              int style,
                              List<String> list)
Expands a date to English words in short, medium or long forms, adding the words to the given list. The style is given by DateFormat.SHORT (e.g., "the first"), DateFormat.MEDIUM (e.g., "the first of May"), and DateFormat.LONG (e.g., "the first of May, two thousand and four").

expandTime

public static void expandTime(Date time,
                              List<String> list)
Expands a time to English words, adding the words to the given list. For example, a date object with time set to 23:02 is expanded to "eleven oh two PM".

expandAmount

public static void expandAmount(String digitString,
                                String currencyCode,
                                List<String> list)
Expands a digit string and currency code to number words and the currency name, which are added to the given list. For example, "12.50" and "GBP" are expanded to "twelve pounds and fifty pence". The codes GBP, USD and EUR are converted to names, while other codes are left as is.

expandDuration

public static void expandDuration(Duration duration,
                                  List<String> list)
Expands a duration into a string of words. NB: Fractions of seconds are ignored at present.

expandDigits

public static void expandDigits(String digitString,
                                List<String> list)
Expands a digit string to a sequence of digit words, which are added to the given list. For example, "1234" is expanded to "one two three four".

expandNumber

public static void expandNumber(String digitString,
                                List<String> list)
Expands a digit string to number words, which are added to the given list. For example, "1234" is expanded to "one thousand two hundred and thirty four". The digit string may contain a single dot in it, as well as an initial plus or minus character. For example, "-100.011" is expanded to "minus one hundred point zero one one". Scientific notation is not currently handled.

expandOrdinal

public static void expandOrdinal(String digitString,
                                 List<String> list)
Expands a digit string to words for an ordinal number, which are added to the given list. For example, "1234" is expanded to "one thousand two hundred and thirty fourth".

expandNDigitNumber

public static void expandNDigitNumber(String digitString,
                                      List<String> list)
